### getFixupNoBits() {#a50b5544d7eeb2d6de0718d0860b96d8c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Hexagon::Fixups HexagonMCCodeEmitter::getFixupNoBits (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinstrinfo">MCInstrInfo</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> &amp; MCII, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinst">MCInst</a> &amp; MI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcoperand">MCOperand</a> &amp; MO, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcsymbolrefexpr/#a5c463f6352570ee778c35c40949c4985">MCSymbolRefExpr::VariantKind</a> VarKind) const</>}>
Some insns are not extended and thus have no bits.

These cases require a more brute force method for determining the correct relocation.
